JobFullDesc: Are you a talented designer, visionary, and tech and business savvy thinker who is able to take disparate pieces of information or abstract ideas and articulate it into designs and actionable plans? We’re looking for a strong design lead and team player to work in a people-centric and culture-first collaborative environment alongside other designers, engineers, strategists, and writers to design and implement best-in-class modern experiences for the world tomorrow supported by thoughtful and intentional technology tomorrow.  We’re the Innovation & Technology team -- a forward-looking team passionate about building innovative technology, implementing delightful designs, saving designers and engineers time through design tooling, prototyping, and automation, as well as working on building the future vision of the next generation of Microsoft products. Our team consists of folks with diverse backgrounds in engineering, design, the sciences, law, and medicine; we come in all shapes and sizes. We love innovating and pushing the boundaries of technology and being a critical part of the Microsoft Design system, which touches many of the popular and well-loved Microsoft products (Teams, Office, Azure, Xbox, and so on). If you’re looking for a change and wanting to make an impact – we invite you to join us in our mission and vision to build the future of UX for Microsoft.   About you You’re a dexterous world-class designer who’s passionate about how ideas come to life through design and engineering, and more importantly, a thoughtful and inclusive collaborator who can bring folks along the journey in striving for product excellence and design excellence. You have experience quickly pulling together strong UI/UX designs or even building some dynamic prototypes yourself to get your ideas across to others. You’re able to tell the story and thinking behind your ideas: the why, what, how, when, and where. Surrounded by talented folks who also have 1,001 ideas, you’re not afraid to dive into the unknown with them and able to help prioritize, organize, and direct efforts to help innovate in ways that are impactful by driving clarity and process.   You’ll nurture and evolve our culture. You’ll design in the open to move fast and build experiences without seams. You’ll share, jam, and contribute to other’s work to make it better. You’ll make to explore, prototype to test – effectively experimenting with an intent to fail fast and learn quick.  Don’t feel like you need to fit into a predefined box matching the role you’re applying for—you never know where the true opportunity may go after we meet you. We’ll provide you with unparalleled levels of opportunity and resources, with the goal of creating experiences that influence the industry, as well as people’s lives.  A day in the life Design polished UI/UX designs and experiences Think through complex problem spaces and drive clarity in ambiguous spaces Articulate your designs through interactive prototypes (or even bring them to life through some lightweight code) Stay up to date on the latest design conventions and practices to bring a suitable look & feel to your designs  Collaborate with other designers and engineers to bring your designs to life through prototypes and design tools  Offer constructive feedback followed by creative and effective solutions Communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholdersResponsibilitiesOther success factors in our dynamic environment: Thoughtfulness—You’re thoughtful and deliberate in your choices and able to articulate them on the fly across a cross-functional team, and occasionally, with facing conflicting priorities and objectives. Bigger picture – Understands how to prevent short-term work from blocking long-term goals, and how the project ladders up to business goals. Business intelligence + persuasion skills—You’ve got the social intelligence and business savvy to understand (or explain) what needs to be changed, prioritized, and why.  Growth mindset — You use criticism to spur insightful conversations. A translator of tradeoffs—There’s no perfect design or implementation, and no right answer. You’re able to create different options and translate the tradeoffs between them in the context of business impact. A facilitator—You know how to collaborate with others and let them put their concerns on the table. Self-awareness – You pay attention to how you impact team health and culture, as well as your personal well-being.
